docs.title: Welcome to your new Fab Academy site
docs.text: This is an example student blog for the Fab Academy.

docs.title: How to edit it
docs.text:
You can edit it on Gitlab. The software used turns simple text files written in Markdown format, into the site you are navigating.

No worries, you can’t break anything, all the changes you make are saved under Version Control using GIT. This means that you have all the different versions of your page saved and available all the time in the Gitlab interface.

docs.title: In short
docs.text:
• This website is built automatically by gitlab every time you edit the files in the docs folder
  • It does so thanks to Mkdocs a static site generator written in Python
  • You must start customizing the file mkdocs.yml with your information
  • You can change the looks of your website using mkdocs themes, you can find in the mkdocs.yml the options for the Material Mkdocs theme
  • If you want to start from scratch, you can delete everything (using git-rm) in this repository and push any other static website

docs.title: About me
docs.text:
Hi! I am Emma Brewer. I am an art director & graphic designer based in New York City working on branding, visual identities, editorial design and web design.

Visit this website to see my work!

docs.title: My background
docs.text: I was born in a nice city called..

docs.title: Previous work
docs.text: I’m a paragraph. Edit the page on Gitlab to add your own text and edit me. I’m a great place for you to tell a story and let your users know a little more about you.​

docs.title: Project A
docs.text:
This is an image from an external site:

While this is an image from the assets/images folder. Never use absolute paths (starting with /) when linking local images, always relative.

docs.title: Student Agreement
docs.text:
This page is a placeholder.

Paste here your agreement.

docs.text: This week I worked on defining my final project idea and started to getting used to the documentation process.

docs.title: Code Example
docs.text:
Use the three backticks to separate code.

// the setup function runs once when you press reset or power the board
void setup() {
  // initialize digital pin LED_BUILTIN as an output.
  pinMode(LED_BUILTIN, OUTPUT);
}

// the loop function runs over and over again forever
void loop() {
  digitalWrite(LED_BUILTIN, HIGH);   // turn the LED on (HIGH is the voltage level)
  delay(1000);                       // wait for a second
  digitalWrite(LED_BUILTIN, LOW);    // turn the LED off by making the voltage LOW
  delay(1000);                       // wait for a second
}

docs.title: From Vimeo
docs.text: Sound Waves from George Gally (Radarboy) on Vimeo.

docs.title: 3D Models
docs.text: Dita's Gown by Francis Bitonti Studio on Sketchfab

docs.title: Use HTML
docs.text:
You may also embed HTML in your markdown files

Try having a seperator line

ID First Name Last Name 235312 John Doe 453123 Mark Jones 998332 Jonathan Smith 345612 Andrew McArthur 453123 Adam Fuller

docs.title: Code Example
docs.text:
Use the three backticks to separate code.

// the setup function runs once when you press reset or power the board
void setup() {
  // initialize digital pin LED_BUILTIN as an output.
  pinMode(LED_BUILTIN, OUTPUT);
}

// the loop function runs over and over again forever
void loop() {
  digitalWrite(LED_BUILTIN, HIGH);   // turn the LED on (HIGH is the voltage level)
  delay(1000);                       // wait for a second
  digitalWrite(LED_BUILTIN, LOW);    // turn the LED off by making the voltage LOW
  delay(1000);                       // wait for a second
}
